fr.sorbonne_u.datacenter.hardware.processors

Class Core

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.datacenter.hardware.processors.Core

  • public class Core
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Core simulates a core in a processor that can execute tasks with a number of instructions known a priori and which can operate at different admissible frequencies.

    Description

    The core has a set of admissible frequencies and for each of these a number of instructions that it can execute per second at this frequency. The execution of tasks uses a discrete event simulation scheme with three events:
    1. start task: the core must be idle, and then it switches to busy and plan the end of the task after the time required to execute the number of instructions in the task;
    2. end task: the core must be busy, and then it switches back to idle;
    3. set new frequency: changes the current frequency of the core to some new admissible value, also replans the end of the task if the core is busy and the delay until the end of the current task is greater than a predefined threshold.
    A core is owned by a processor component, which threads will be used to execute the core's methods. Callbacks to the processor of accesses to its instance variables assume that no synchronization is required.

    Invariant

     invariant              owner != null and admissibleFrequencies != null
 invariant              admissibleFrequencies.contains(defaultFrequency)
 invariant              forall i in admissibleFrequencies, i > 0
 invariant              processingPower != null
 invariant              forall i in processingPower.values(), i > 0

    Created on : January 15, 2015

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> admissibleFrequencies
      possible frequencies in MHz.
      protected int coreNo
      number of the core in the processor.
      protected int currentFrequency
      current frequency of the core.
      protected TaskI currentTask
      task currently running on the core, if any, null otherwise.
      protected java.util.concurrent.Future<?> currentTaskEndFuture
      a future giving a handle on the end of task processing currently scheduled, allowing to cancel it when a replanning of the end if necessary.
      protected long currentTaskProjectedTermination
      projected time of ending of the current task.
      protected int defaultFrequency
      default frequency at which the cores run.
      protected boolean idle
      true if the core is currently idle, false otherwise.
      protected long lastTaskReStartTime
      starting time or last restarting time of the current task.
      protected Processor owner
      owner processor.
      protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> processingPower
      Mips for the different possible frequencies.
      protected static int SHORTEST_DELAY_FOR_REPLANNING
      shortest delay (in ms) before task termination to authorize a replanning of its termination event after changing the frequency.

      • Core

        public Core(Processor owner,
            int coreNo,
            java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> admissibleFrequencies,
            java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> processingPower,
            int defaultFrequency)
        create a core object.

        Contract

         pre    owner != null
 pre    coreNo >= 0
 pre    admissibleFrequencies != null and forall i in admissibleFrequencies, i >= 0
 pre    processingPower != null and forall i in processingPower.values(), i >= 0
 pre    forall i in admissibleFrequencies, processingPower.containsKey(i)
 pre    admissibleFrequencies.contains(defaultFrequency)
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        owner - owner processor.
        coreNo - number of the core.
        admissibleFrequencies - possible frequencies in MHz.
        processingPower - Mips for the different possible frequencies.
        defaultFrequency - default frequency at which the cores run.

 post   this.isIdle() and this.currentTask == null and this.currentTaskEndFuture == null

      • computeNumberOfInstructionsForTime

        public long computeNumberOfInstructionsForTime(long time,
                                               int frequency)
        compute the number of instructions that the core can execute in some given time given in milliseconds for some frequency of the core.

        Contract

         pre    time > 0 and this.admissibleFrequency(frequency)
 post   return >= 0
        Parameters:
        time - time given to execute (in milliseconds).
        frequency - frequency at which the core would execute (in MHz).
        Returns:
        number of instructions that can be executed.
